node.doctext:
Ok, this isn't really a FAQ, more like a HOWTO, but I'm following site naming convensions here...

This is just a checklist for the very rare times a user should be deleted. In most cases, the user should be locked instead of nuking them from the face of the Everything. If it is decided that a user should be deleted, it would probably be smart to only let [nate], [JayBonci], or I do it (AFAIK, they're the only ones that know how to do all these steps anyway). In these steps, DELETE_ID refers to the soon-to-be-deleted-user's node_id.
-- [N-Wing]

lock them

see if they wrote any writeups, and possibly delete them (if the user is bad enough to be deleted, their writeups were probably way stupid anyway)

likewise, maybe their node heaven WUs should be nuked; or maybe not, it doesn't take much space

make sure they don't have any messages from people
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM message WHERE for_user=DELETE_ID
if they do, maybe send the messages back to the original sender, saying it was sent to DELETE_TITLE, who was deleted (if there are more than a few, it would be easy enough to write a little tool to do this)

see if there are any messages from the soon-to-be-delete-user
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM message WHERE author_user=DELETE_ID
do not delete those messages; the recipients most likely wouldn't want that; instead, it could be nice to send a /msg to each recipient DELETE_TITLE and DELETE_ID, so they can figure out who messages were from, if they want to
